channel.title: Elements help
channel.description:
Well im mexican, i live in mexico uhm im in what would it be in the us? i think it 9th grade, and i have this homework from chemistry.
"b) whats The importance of the elements chlorine, selenium, magnesium, potassium, sodium, zinc, magnesium, iodine and phosphorus used in commercial dietary supplement."
can anyone help me a bit? _I have no clue where to start.

item.title: Elements help
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Phosphorus may be used to create an inorganic phosphate molecule for the synthesis of adenosine triphosphate which is an important molecule that is used for storage of energy. The other molecules could be used as enzymatic inhibitors or allosteric inhibitors or activators. Zinc is definitely used as a cofacfor.

Read full topic

item.title: Elements help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

They’re all supplements to your diet. Things the body should have that you may not get enough from your regular food intake.

At least, that’s what I’m told.

Read full topic

item.title: Elements help
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

thx i found some really useful info, already finished

Read full topic

item.title: Elements help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

What’s so hard about this?

Just find out what they’re used for e.g.

the average person’s body contains about 25 grams of magnesium, and about half of that is in the bones
cool we have a point so develop onto it e.g.
Magnesium protects against heart disease and heart attacks, high blood pressure and stroke, type II diabetes and much, much more.
then give a quick summery of everything. it's good for preventing crap happening to you.

Same with chlorine, it’s used a lot in swimming pools because it kills bacteria and other crap that you don’t want going inside you.

ofc this isn’t how you should be doing it (i just threw random stuff of google) but you should get the point lol

Do the rest ya lazy boy!

Read full topic
